content.user_title: Configure MCP servers for Claude Code plugins
content.value_statement: You need to connect plugins to external tools without unclear setup. This skill provides clear MCP server configurations, authentication patterns, and tool usage guidance.
actual_capabilities: Explain how to configure MCP servers in .mcp.json or plugin.json
Describe stdio, SSE, HTTP, and WebSocket server types with use cases
Show environment variable expansion for commands and headers
Define MCP tool naming and allowed-tools patterns
Outline OAuth, token, and env var authentication approaches
limitations: Does not implement MCP servers or provide runtime code
Requires access to plugin configuration files
Depends on external MCP server availability and credentials
OAuth behavior depends on the server provider

use_cases.title: Add a hosted MCP service
use_cases.description: Configure an SSE server with OAuth for a cloud provider and document required scopes.

use_cases.title: Standardize MCP config
use_cases.description: Create a portable .mcp.json using environment variables and secure URLs.

use_cases.title: Audit MCP tool access
use_cases.description: Review allowed-tools lists and remove risky wildcards.

prompt_templates.title: Basic MCP setup
prompt_templates.scenario: I need a simple MCP server in my plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a .mcp.json for a single stdio server using ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} and one environment variable.

prompt_templates.title: OAuth SSE server
prompt_templates.scenario: I want to connect to a hosted MCP service
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an SSE MCP configuration and list the steps users will see for OAuth authorization.

prompt_templates.title: Multi server config
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a .mcp.json with one stdio server and one HTTP server with token headers.

prompt_templates.title: Tool access policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this command intent and suggest specific MCP tools to pre-allow without wildcards.

output_examples.input: Show me a secure MCP setup for a plugin that uses an HTTP API.
output: Use an HTTP server type with an HTTPS URL
Store the API token in an environment variable
Add the Authorization header using the variable
Document required variables in the README

best_practices: Use HTTPS or WSS for all MCP connections
Document required environment variables and scopes
anti_patterns: Using HTTP or WS for production servers
Allowing all MCP tools with wildcards

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. It targets Claude Code plugin MCP configuration and tool usage.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and depends on external server limits and credentials.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my plugin?
faq.answer: Create .mcp.json or add mcpServers in plugin.json and restart Claude Code.

faq.question: Does it store my tokens or data?
faq.answer: No. It describes secure patterns and relies on Claude Code token handling.

faq.question: What if the MCP server does not connect?
faq.answer: Check URL, authentication, environment variables, and use claude --debug logs.

faq.question: How does it compare to custom integration code?
faq.answer: It standardizes MCP setup without writing custom client logic.
